  Text content: The AI chip and supercomputer supply chain is complex and demands the most advanced manufacturing, packaging, assembly and test technologies. NVIDIA is partnering with Amkor and SPIL for packaging and testing operations in Arizona.Within the next four years, NVIDIA plans to produce up to half a trillion dollars of AI infrastructure in the United States through partnerships with TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor and SPIL. content after edit: This slide explains the complexity of the AI chip and supercomputer supply chain. Key partnerships with Amkor and SPIL in Arizona highlight NVIDIA's strategy for advanced packaging and testing. The note emphasizes NVIDIA's ambitious plan to produce up to half a trillion dollars worth of AI infrastructure in the U.S. within four years through collaborations with industry leaders like TSMC, Foxconn, Wistron, Amkor, and SPIL. These partnerships aim to strengthen global footprint and supply chain resilience.
